message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using the World Development Indicators dataset and a panel data model, we analyze the impact of public investment on economic growth in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "We make use of the National Health Interview Survey (NHIS) and the National Vital Statistics System (NVSS) datasets to estimate the effects of air pollution on mortality rates in the United States.", "dataset": ["National Health Interview Survey (NHIS)", "National Vital Statistics System (NVSS)"], "topic": ["Environment", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "This article presents an analysis of firm-level survey data from the Enterprise Surveys program for 25 Sub-Saharan African countries.", "dataset": ["Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We combine household survey data from the National Household Income and Expenditure Survey (NHIES) with satellite imagery to assess the impact of large-scale commercial agriculture expansion on land use change and household welfare in Cambodia.", "dataset": ["National Household Income and Expenditure Survey (NHIES)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using a proprietary dataset on social media behavior and product purchases, we investigate how social media usage is related to consumer behavior and preferences.", "dataset": ["proprietary dataset on social media behavior and product purchases"], "topic": ["Digital Development"]}, {"sentence": "By merging data on firms' international shipments from the Colombian customs office with value-added tax (VAT) administrative records, we estimate the prevalence of export underreporting and its impact on productivity measures.", "dataset": ["Colombian customs office", "value-added tax (VAT) administrative records"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries"]}, {"sentence": "To investigate the determinants of gender wage gaps in Ecuador, we use household survey data from the Encuesta Nacional de Empleo, Desempleo y Subempleo (ENEMDU) and develop decomposition analyses.", "dataset": ["Encuesta Nacional de Empleo, Desempleo y Subempleo (ENEMDU)"], "topic": ["Gender"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses a newly constructed dataset of firm-level electricity consumption in Pakistan to investigate how electricity prices affect industrial competitiveness.", "dataset": ["firm-level electricity consumption in Pakistan"], "topic": ["Energy", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We collected data on miles driven from the National Household Travel Survey and matched it with meteorological data from the Global Historical Climatology Network to investigate the effect of weather on driving patterns and traffic fatalities in the United States.", "dataset": ["National Household Travel Survey", "Global Historical Climatology Network"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Transport"]}, {"sentence": "Using satellite imagery data and household surveys from India, we assess the impact of electrification efforts and increased access to affordable clean energy on health outcomes and economic well-being in rural areas.", "dataset": ["satellite imagery data", "household surveys from India"], "topic": ["Health", "Energy", "Poverty"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "Using the World Development Indicators dataset and a panel data model, we analyze the impact of public investment on economic growth in low-income countries.", "dataset":
